contextId.information: You may need to specify what the message is. AT: "have served God by telling people his message" or "have taught people the good news about Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

"His wife was descended from Aaron." This means she was from the same line of priests as Zechariah. AT: "His wife was also descended from Aaron" or "Zechariah and his wife Elizabeth were both descended from Aaron" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: His wife was from the daughters of Aaron

contextId.information: The courtyard was the enclosed area surrounding the temple. AT: "outside the temple building" or "in the courtyard outside the temple" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

"God has heard what you asked." The following is implied and could be added: "and will grant it." God did not just hear what Zechariah prayed for; he was also going to do it. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

It is not stated how they will be ready. This implied information could be added. AT: "make ready to believe the Lord's message" or "make ready to obey the Lord" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"in the sixth month of Elizabeth's pregnancy." It may be necessary to state this clearly if it would be confused with the sixth month of the year. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
It is implied that Mary finished her journey before she went in to Zechariah's house. This could be stated clearly. AT: "When she arrived, she went" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

This was often a ceremony where one person circumcised the baby and friends were there to celebrate with the family. AT: "for the baby's circumcision ceremony" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

It may be helpful to state how Zechariah "asked," since he could not speak. AT: "His father used his hands to show the people that he wanted them to give him a writing tablet" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: His father asked for a writing tablet

contextId.information: "Israel" here refers to the nation of Israel. The relationship between God and Israel could be stated more directly. AT: "the God who reigns over Israel" or "the God whom Israel worships" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
God enabled the prophets to speak the words he wanted them to speak. God's control can the stated. AT: "caused his holy prophets to say" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: spoke by the mouth of his holy prophets

contextId.information: It might be helpful to state that God's mercy helps people. AT: "because God is compassionate and merciful to us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: because of the tender mercy of our God

contextId.information: This refers to the cities where people's ancestors lived. People may have lived in a different city. AT: "the city in which his ancestors lived" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

This was the normal way that mothers protected and cared for their babies in that culture. AT: "wrapped a warm blanket firmly around him" or "wrapped him comfortably in a blanket" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: wrapped him in long strips of cloth

contextId.information: "for them to become ceremonially clean." You can also state God's role. AT: "for God to consider them to be clean again" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This is pointing to the many comforts to Israel when Messiah comes. AT: "the one who would comfort Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This refers to the courtyard around the temple. Only the priests were allowed in the temple. AT: "in the temple courtyard" or "at the temple" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

"Abraham is our ancestor" or "We are Abraham's descendants." If it is unclear why they would say this, you may also add the implied information: "so God will not punish us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: We have Abraham for our father

contextId.information: John's answer about a greater person coming clearly implies that John is not the Christ. It may be helpful to state this clearly for your audience, as the UDB does: "No, I am not" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

"because Herod married Herodias, his own brother's wife." This was evil because Herod's brother was still alive. This can be stated clearly. AT: "because he married his brother's wife, Herodias, while his brother was still alive" See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: for marrying his brother's wife Herodias

contextId.information: Jesus' rejection of the devil's challenge is clearly implied in his answer. It may be helpful to state this clearly for your audience, as the UDB does: "Jesus replied, 'No, I will not do that'" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

This can be stated in active form. Possibly meanings are that "them" refers to 1) the authority and splendor of the kingdoms or 2) the kingdoms. AT: "God has given them to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: they have been given to me

contextId.information: This contrast implies that Jesus refused to do what the devil asked. It may be helpful to state this clearly for your audience. AT: "But Jesus replied, 'No, I will not worship you, because it is written'" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: But Jesus answered ... It is written

contextId.information: The devil implies that his quote from the Psalms means Jesus will not be hurt if he is the Son of God. This can be stated clearly, as the UDB does: AT: "You will not be hurt, because it is written" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

Jesus tells the devil why he will not do what the devil told him to do. His refusal to do it can be stated clearly. AT: "No, I will not do that, because it is said" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

This does not imply that the devil was successful in his temptationâ€”Jesus resisted every attempt. This can be stated clearly. AT: "had finished trying to tempt Jesus" (UDB) or "stopped trying to tempt Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

The people to whom Jesus was speaking would have known that Elijah was one of God's prophets. If your readers would not know that, you can make this implicit information explicit as in the UDB. AT: "when Elijah was prophesying in Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

The people living in the town of Zarephath were Gentiles, not Jews. The people listening to Jesus would have understood that the people of Zarephath were Gentiles. AT: "a Gentile widow living in Zarephath" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
contextId.quote: to Zarephath ... to a widow living there

contextId.information: This means they asked Jesus to heal her from the fever. This can be stated clearly. AT: "asked Jesus to heal her from the fever" or "asked Jesus to cure her fever" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: pleaded with him on her behalf

contextId.information: "spoke sternly to the fever" or "commanded the fever to leave her" (UDB). It may be helpful to state clearly what he told the fever to do. AT: "commanded that her skin should become cool" or "commanded the sickness to leave her" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"the boats began to sink." The reason could be stated clearly. AT: "the boats began to sink because the fish were so heavy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
It is understood that he was asking Jesus to heal him. This can be stated clearly. AT: "please make me clean, because you are able" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

This refers to ceremonial cleanness, but it is understood that he is unclean because of the leprosy. He is really asking Jesus to heal him of his disease. This can be stated clearly. AT: "heal me from leprosy so I will be clean ... Be healed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

Houses had flat roofs, and some houses had a ladder or staircase outside to make it easy to go up there. This can be stated. AT: "they went up to the flat roof of the house" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: they went up to the housetop

contextId.information: The Greek style of eating at a feast was to lie on a couch and prop oneself up with the left arm on some pillows. AT: "eating together" or "eating at the table" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Fasting is a sign of sadness. The religious leaders understood that the wedding attendants would not fast while the bridegroom was with them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the wedding attendants of the bridegroom fast

contextId.information: When the new wine ferments and expands, it breaks the old skins because they can no longer stretch out. Jesus' audience would have understood the information about the wine's fermenting and expanding. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the new wine would burst the skins

contextId.information: It may be helpful to add: "and he is therefore not willing to try the new wine" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: for he says, 'The old is better.'

contextId.information: They did this to separate the grain seeds. This can be stated clearly. AT: "They rubbed them in their hands to separate the grains from the husks" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The Pharisees considered even the small action of rubbing a handful of grain to be unlawful work. This can be stated clearly. AT: "doing work" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This is implied information added to the ULB text. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: The names of the apostles were

contextId.information: It may be necessary to explain what "traitor" means in this context. AT: "betrayed his friend" or "turned his friend over to enemies" (usually in return for money paid) or "exposed a friend to danger by telling enemies about him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
God is the one who blesses. This can made explicit. AT: "Ask God to bless those" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

"dug the foundation of the house deep enough to reach a foundation of solid rock." Some cultures may not be familiar with building on bedrock, and may need to use another image for a stable foundation. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: built the house's foundation on solid rock

contextId.information: Some cultures may not know that a house with a foundation is stronger. Additional information may be helpful. AT: "but he did not dig down and build first a foundation" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: on top of the ground without a foundation

contextId.information: The implication is that Jesus expected Jewish people to have this kind of faith, but they did not. He did not expect Gentiles to have this kind of faith, yet this man did. You may need to add this implied information. AT: "I have not found any Israelite who trusts me as much as this Gentile does!" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: not even in Israel have I found such faith

contextId.information: The spiritual state of people in the kingdom of God will be higher than of the people before the kingdom was established. AT: "higher spiritual status than John" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

Simon wrongly assumed that a prophet would never allow a sinner to touch him. This fact could be added. AT: "is a sinner and would not allow her to touch him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
It was a basic responsibility of a host to provide water and a towel for guests to wash and dry their feet after walking on dusty roads. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: You gave me no water for my feet

contextId.information: A good host in that culture would greet his guest with a kiss on the cheek. Simon did not do this. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: You did not give me a kiss

contextId.information: "put oil on my head." This was the custom to welcome an honored guest. AT: "welcome me by anointing my head with oil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

"anyone who is forgiven only a few things." In this sentence Jesus states a general principle. However, he expected Simon to understand that he showed very little love for Jesus. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the one who is forgiven little

contextId.information: The religious leaders knew that only God could forgive sin, and did not believe that Jesus was God. This question was probably intended to be an accusation. AT: "Who does this man think he is? Only God can forgive sin!" or "Why is this man pretending to be God who can forgive sin?" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Who is this that even forgives sins?

contextId.information: The strong winds caused high waves which pushed water over the sides of the boat. This can be stated clearly. AT: "the winds caused high waves that started to fill up their boat with water" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: their boat was filling with water

contextId.information: By saying this, Peter was implying that anyone could have touched Jesus. This implicit information can be made explicit if necessary. AT: "there are many people crowding around you and pressing in against you, so any one of them might have touched you!" (UDB) (See [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the crowds of people ... are pressing in against you

contextId.information: Jesus did not lose power or become weak, but his power healed the woman. AT: "I know that healing power went out from me" or "I felt my power heal someone" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: I know that power has gone out from me

contextId.information: This statement implies that Jesus will not be able to do anything to help now that the girl is dead. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

This was the normal way of showing grief in that culture. AT: "all the people there were showing how sad they were and crying loudly because the girl had died" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: all were mourning and wailing for her

contextId.information: "Her spirit returned to her body." The Jews understood that life was the result of the spirit coming into a person. AT: "She came back to life" or "She became alive again" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

Herod assumed that it was impossible for John to rise from the dead. This can be stated clearly. AT: "It cannot be John because I had his head cut off. So who is this man" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: I beheaded John, but who is this

contextId.information: This refers to looking up, toward the sky. The Jews believed that heaven was located above the sky. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
It may be helpful to clarify how this answer relates to Jesus' question. AT: "that you are one of the prophets from long ago and have risen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: that one of the prophets from long ago has risen

contextId.information: These adult disciples were not afraid of clouds. This phrase indicates that some kind of unusual fear came over them with the cloud. AT: "they were terrified" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
It is understood that the voice could only have belonged to God. AT: "God spoke to them from the cloud" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: A voice came out of the cloud

contextId.information: Jesus does not identify these men here, but it might be helpful to state that information. AT: "to my enemies" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The Samaritans and the Jews hated each other. Therefore the Samaritans would not help Jesus on his journey to Jerusalem, the Jewish capital. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: because he had set his face to go to Jerusalem

contextId.information: James and John suggested this method of judgment because they knew that this was how the prophets such as Elijah had judged people who rejected God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: command fire to come down from heaven and destroy them

contextId.information: It may be helpful to clearly state the reason for their judgment. AT: "But because you did not repent and believe in me even though you saw me do miracles, God will judge you more severely than he will judge the people of Tyre and Sidon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: But it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon at the judgment than for you

contextId.information: Some languages will need to say that the seventy actually went out first as the UDB does. This is implicit information that can be made explicit. (See [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The word "privately" indicates that he was alone with his disciples.  AT: "Later, when he was alone with his disciples, he turned to them and said" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Then he turned around to the disciples and said privately

contextId.information: This implies that Jesus was not yet doing those things. AT: "but could not see them because I was not doing them yet" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: and they did not see them

contextId.information: This implies that Jesus was not yet teaching. AT: "but could not hear them because I had not yet started to teach" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: and they did not hear them

contextId.information: "when the priest saw the injured man." A priest is a very religious person, so the audience would assume that he would help the injured man. Since he did not, this phrase could be stated as "but when he saw him" to call attention to this unexpected result. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

The Levites served in the temple. He would be expected to help his fellow Jewish man. Since he did not, it may are helpful to state that. AT: "he also did not help, but instead passed by on the other side" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: passed by on the other side

contextId.information: "For you say that it is by the power of Beelzebul that I make demons leave people." The next part of his argument can be stated explicitly: "That would mean that Satan is divided against himself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: For you say I cast out demons by Beelzebul

contextId.information: Jesus is referring to gathering disciples who follow him. This can be stated explicitly. AT: "anyone who does not cause people to come and follow me causes them to go away from me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the one who does not gather with me scatters

contextId.information: "They want me to give them a sign" or "Many of you want me to give you a sign." The information about what kind of sign they wanted can be made explicit. AT: "Many of you want me to perform a miracle as proof that I have come from God" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Jesus is speaking about himself. AT: "I am greater than Solomon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
It may be helpful to state explicitly that this refers to the ancient city of Nineveh. AT: "The men who lived in the ancient city of Nineveh" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
It may be helpful to explicitly state that they have not listened to Jesus. AT: "I am greater than Jonah but you have not repented" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: someone greater than Jonah is here

contextId.information: "sat down at the table." It was the custom for a relaxed meal such as this dinner for men to eat while lying down comfortably around the table. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

When the Jews walked over a grave, they would become ceremonially unclean. These unmarked graves caused them to accidentally do that. This can be stated clearly. AT: "without realizing it and become ceremonially unclean" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

Jesus is rebuking the Pharisees and teachers of the law. They knew about the murder of the prophets, but did not condemn their ancestors for killing them. AT: "So, rather than denouncing them, you confirm and agree" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: So you are witnesses and you consent

contextId.information: The phrase "the one" refers to God. This could be stated. AT: "Fear God who" or "Fear God, because" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

What is confessed can be stated clearly. AT: "whoever tells others that he is my disciple" or "anyone who acknowledges before others that he is loyal to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: everyone who confesses me before men

contextId.information: "he who disowns me before people." What is denied can be stated clearly. AT: "whoever refuses to acknowledge to others that he is my disciple" or "if anyone refuses to say that he is loyal to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: he who denies me before men

contextId.information: Inheritances came from the father in that culture. This could be stated. AT: "share my father's property with me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

People wore long flowing robes. They would tuck them into their belt to keep the robes out of the way while they worked. AT: "Tuck your clothing into your belt so you are ready to serve" or "Be dressed and ready to serve" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Let your long clothing be tucked in at your belt

contextId.information: This refers to the door of the master's house. It was the responsibility of his servants to open it for him.  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This condition normally meant rain was coming in Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: When you see a cloud rising ... happens

contextId.information: Here "blood" refers to the death of the Galileans. They were probably killed while they were offering their sacrifices. This could be stated explicitly as in the UDB. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: whose blood Pilate mixed with their own sacrifices

contextId.information: Here "I say" emphasizes "No." It may be helpful to state Jesus' point clearly. AT: "They certainly did not die because they were more sinful" or "You are wrong to think that their suffering proves that they were more sinful" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"put manure in the soil." Manure is animal dung. People put it in the ground to make the soil good for plants and trees. AT: "put fertilizer on it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

Jesus speaks directly to the synagogue ruler, but the plural form includes the other religious rulers also. This can be stated explicitly. AT: "You and your fellow religious leaders are hypocrites" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
It is implied that they will not be able to enter because of the difficulty of entering. The next verse explains the difficulty. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: many will want to enter, but will not be able to enter

contextId.information: Oxen were used in pairs to pull farming tools. AT: "10 oxen to work in my fields" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

It may be necessary to state clearly the implied information that the servant did what the master commanded him. AT: "After the servant went out and did that, he came back and said" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

It is understood that he was not able to finish because he did not have enough money. This could be stated. AT: "does not have enough money to be able to finish" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This was the way shepherds carried sheep. This could be stated. AT: "lays it across his shoulders to carry it home" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

"wished very much that he could eat." It is understood that this is because he was very hungry. This could be stated. AT: "he was so hungry that he would have happily eaten" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

A calf is a young cow. People would give one of their calves special food so that it would grow well, and then when they wanted to have a special feast, they would eat that calf. AT: "the best calf" or "the young animal we have been making fat" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
It is implied that he was out in the field because he was working there. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

A calf is a young cow. People would give one of their calves special food so that it would grow well, and then when they wanted to have a special feast, they would eat that calf. AT: "the best calf" or "the young animal we have been making fat." See how you translated this phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:luk:15:22|15:23]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
A young goat was smaller and less expensive than a fatted calf. AT: "even a young goat" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

A calf is a young cow. People would give one of their calves special food so that it would grow well, and then when they wanted to have a special feast, they would eat that calf. AT: "the best calf" or "the young animal we have been making fat." See how you translated this phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:luk:15:22|15:23]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This refers to John the Baptist. AT: "John the Baptist came" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

This implies that Abraham and Lazarus were reclining next to each other at a feast, in the Greek style of feasting. The joy in heaven is often represented in the scriptures by the idea of a feast. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: to Abraham's side ... at his side

contextId.information: It is implied that the way they would avoid going there is by repenting. AT: "and they might repent and not come" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: for fear that they also come

contextId.information: It is implied that Abraham refused to send Lazarus to the rich man's brothers. This could be stated. AT: "No, I will not do that, because your brothers have what Moses and the prophets wrote long ago" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: They have Moses and the prophets

contextId.information: "tie your clothes at your waist and serve me" or "dress up properly and take care of me." People would tie their clothes closely around their waist so that their clothes would not get in their way while they worked. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: put a belt around your clothes and serve me

contextId.information: Lepers were required to have the priests verify that their leprosy was healed. AT: "show yourselves to the priests so they can examine you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

When people were healed, they were no longer ceremonially unclean. This can be made explicit. AT: "they became clean when they were healed of their leprosy" or "they were cured of their leprosy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This refers to the kingdom of God. AT: "one of the days when the Son of Man will rule as king" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: one of the days of the Son of Man

contextId.information: This refers to seeking the Messiah. AT: "Look, the Messiah is over there! He is over here!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

The "days of Lot" refers to the time just before God punished the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah. AT: "Another example is how it happened in the days of Lot" or "As people were doing when Lot lived" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Likewise even as it happened in the days of Lot

contextId.information: The Pharisees believed that tax collectors were as sinful as robbers, unrighteous people, and adulterers. This could be made explicit. AT: "and I am certainly not like this sinful tax collector who cheats people!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: or even like this tax collector

contextId.information: He was justified because God forgave his sin. AT: "God forgave the tax collector" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: this man went back down to his house justified

contextId.information: The Jews hated the tax collectors and did not think any good person should associate with them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

The Jews believed that the Messiah would establish the kingdom as soon as he came to Jerusalem. AT: "that Jesus would immediately begin to rule over God's kingdom" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: that the kingdom of God was about to appear immediately

contextId.information: This is the image of a lesser king going to a greater king. The greater king would give the lesser king the right and authority to rule over his own country. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: to receive for himself a kingdom

contextId.information: It is implied that the servant was the one who caused the profit. AT: "I used your mina to make a profit of ten more minas" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: your mina has made ten minas more

contextId.information: It is implied that the servant was the one who caused the profit. AT: "Lord, I used your mina to make a profit of five more minas" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Your mina, lord, has made five minas

contextId.information: It is implied that what he has is the money he earned by using his mina faithfully. AT: "everyone who uses well what he has been given" or "everyone who uses well what I have given him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

It is implied that the reason he does not have money is because he did not use his mina faithfully. AT: "from the person who does not use well what I have given him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Only priests were allowed to enter the temple building. AT: "went into the temple courtyard" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

This is the reason that they did not arrest Jesus right away. The people respected Jesus, and the religious leaders were afraid of what the people might do if they arrested him. AT: "they did not arrest him because they were afraid of the people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: they were afraid of the people

contextId.information: "Rule" and "authority" are two ways of saying that they wanted the governor to judge Jesus. It can be translated with one or both expressions. AT: "so that the governor would punish Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: to the rule and to the authority of the governor

contextId.information: The Jews considered the children born from this kind of second marriage to belong to the dead man. They inherited his property and possessions and carried on his name. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: have a child for his brother

contextId.information: In that culture they spoke of men marrying women and women being given in marriage to their husband. This can also be stated in active form. AT: "get married" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: marry and are given in marriage

contextId.information: In that culture they spoke of men marrying women and women being given in marriage to their husband. This can also be stated in active form. AT: "will not marry" or "will not get married." This is after the resurrection. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: will neither marry nor be given in marriage

contextId.information: "Some of the scribes said to Jesus." There were scribes present when the Sadducees were questioning Jesus. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

"they were afraid to ask ... questions" or "they did not risk asking ... questions." They understood that they did not know as much as Jesus did, but they did not want to say that. This can be made explicit. AT: "they did ask him any more tricky questions because they feared that his wise answers would make them appear foolish again" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: they did not dare ask him any more questions

contextId.information: Long robes would show that they were important. AT: "who like to walk around wearing their important robes" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: who desire to walk in long robes

contextId.information: This refers to the final judgment. AT: "the end of the world will not happen immediately after the wars and riots" or "the world will not end immediately after those things happen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the end will not happen immediately

contextId.information: "there will be wrath to the people at that time." God will bring this wrath. AT: "this people will experience God's anger" or "God will be very angry and will punish this people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

"summer is about to start." Summer in Israel follows the sprouting of fig tree leaves and is the time when the figs ripen. AT: "harvest time is ready to start" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Only priests were allowed in the temple. AT: "at the temple" or "in the temple courtyard" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

The festival was called by this name because during the festival, the Jews did not eat bread that was made with yeast. AT: "festival when they would eat unleavened bread" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

Each family or group of people would kill a lamb and eat it together, so many lambs were killed. This can be stated in active form. AT: "people had to kill the lamb for the Passover meal" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the Passover lamb must be sacrificed

contextId.information: The man could probably tell Peter was from Galilee from the way he talked. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

The Jewish day started at sundown and continued to the next evening. Jesus had spoken the previous evening about what would happen shortly before dawn or at dawn. AT: "tonight" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

The council asked this question because they wanted Jesus to explicitly confirm their understanding that he was saying he was the Son of God. AT: "So when you said that, did you mean that you are the Son of God?" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Then you are the Son of God?

contextId.information: The passage does not state the implied fact that Herod was the ruler of Galilee. AT: "Jesus was under the authority of Herod because Herod ruled over Galilee" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

The implied information is that they became friends because Herod appreciated Pilate allowing him to judge Jesus. AT: "Herod and Pilate became friends with each other that very day because Pilate had sent Jesus to Herod for judgment" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Herod and Pilate had become friends with each other that very day

contextId.information: It is not likely that Pilate asked a crowd to come. The crowd was probably still there waiting to see what would happen to Jesus. AT: "the crowd that was still there" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

"I have questioned Jesus in your presence, and." It is implied that they were witnesses to the proceedings. AT: "I have questioned Jesus with you here as witnesses, and" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: I, having questioned him before you

contextId.information: "Take this man away!" They are asking for Jesus to be killed. AT: "Take this man away and execute him!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
These were used in the burial process in that time. AT: "prepared spices and ointments to prepare Jesus' body for burial" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
You can state explicitly that they did not find it because it was not there. AT: "the body of the Lord Jesus was not there!" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: did not find the body of the Lord Jesus

contextId.information: "only the linen cloths." This refers to the cloth that had been wrapped around Jesus' body when he was buried in [[:en:bible:notes:luk:23:52|23:53]]. It is implied that the body of Jesus was not there. AT: "the linen cloths in which Jesus' body had been wrapped, but Jesus was not there" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The Romans ruled over the Jews. AT: "who would free the Israelites from our Roman enemies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Jesus did this to prove that he had a physical body. Spirits would not be able to eat food. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"I will give you what my Father promised to give you." God had promised to give the Holy Spirit. The UDB makes this explicit. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: I am sending you what my Father promised
